description: Since the beginning of 2020, I have sewn (or thrifted) all of my clothing.
Here's some of my projects!

projects.title: Autumn Leaves Set
description: This project might not be entirely practical (though I think 'casual business tree' should become a fashion trend) but I had a lot of fun designing and making it! Sewing 1300 leaves to the skirt was surprisingly meditative and only took a few days. I really love the outcome and wearing it is a lot of fun!

For more versatility, I decided to make the dress a two piece set, a historical stays inspired top and a vaguely 18th century silhouette skirt. Inspiration for this project came from Bernadette Banner's leaves cape, PricklyAlpaca's leaves dress and the Critical Role character Keyleth.

projects.title: Terrarium Jacket
description: This terrarium inspired jacket is made from a fake plant and curtains from IKEA. The idea for the project came from Rachel Maksys "Terrarium Sleeves" project.

projects.title: Upcycled Towel Jacket
description: For making this jacket, I upcycled two old towels. For the pattern, I slightly modified the pattern I made for the red jacket with white stitching details.

projects.title: Upcycled Sail Jacket
description: This jacket is made from an upcycled old sail. The design is inspired by a retro windbreaker I saw on Pinterest. The material is very stiff but great at repelling rain.

projects.title: Ray Shirt
description: A decorated t-shirt I made using the Sparrow Tee pattern by Common Stitch.

projects.title: Renaissance Inspired Sweatshirt
description: I love integrating history and fantasy inspired pieces into my wardrobe, so I decided to sew myself a renaissance slashed sleeve sweatshirt :)
I drafted the pattern based on a sweatshirt that I own. The sleeve pattern can be seen in the 4th image.
I bought the fabric I used for this project in Amsterdam, the red parts are sweatshirt fabric and the white parts are cotton.
I really love how it turned out!

projects.title: Cable Organizer Pouch
description: I needed something to organize the mess of chargers floating around in my backpack, so I decided to sew an organizer pouch. It works great!

projects.title: Burgundy Jacket
description: A burgundy jacket with a lot of white topstitching done by hand. The fabric I used is the burgundy cotton satin "Valerie" by Stoffe Hemmers. As this was a spontaneous project, I used the fabric I had in my stash, otherwise I would have either added a lining or chosen a softer fabric.
The pattern is self-drafted, based on another jacket in my wardrobe.

projects.title: Renaissance Fair Dress
description: When I designed this dress, I wanted it to be inspired by the (partially) historical dresses worn at renaissance fairs.
The pattern is self-drafted. I used a burgundy linen and this lace in off-white from Stoff & Stil.

projects.title: Embroidered T-Shirt
description: A t-shirt I sewed and embroidered on. I used the Sparrow Tee pattern by Common Stitch and jersey from Selfmade. The lineart design is by the Brazilian artist Ninhol.

projects.title: Couture-esque Bodysuit
description: My goal is making a more couture-esque, Jean-Paul Gaultier inspired project.
The pattern is self-drafted. The shoulder details are made using synthetic boning encased in black satin.

projects.title: My Prom Dress
description: This is the dress I made for my graduation. Technically, there would have been a prom but it got cancelled due to the pandemic.
For the skirt, I used a 3/4 circle skirt. The bodice is the 'Rose Caf√© Bustier' by Daria Patternmaking and can be found here.
The fabric I used is 'Baumwollsatin Valerie' by Stoffe Hemmers. It is a heavier cotton satin.

projects.title: Blue Velvet Blazer
description: My first attempt at sewing a blazer. I used a blue velvet that I got second hand, it used to be an upholstery fabric so it is a bit bulky for a blazer.
The pattern I used is 'The Ercilla Suit' by moodfabrics and can be found here.

projects.title: "This is fine" T-Shirt
description: A fun project to experiment with painting on fabric.
The pattern is drafted based on another t-shirt in my wardrobe.
Linocuts and Stamps
